body: I find can not submit job with oozie to between hadoop 2.5.0 cluster and oozie can not tracker job status,so i resolved it.
Ping?

Hi,

Thanks for finding and fixing this bug.  However, we don't do pull requests.  Can you file a JIRA against Oozie (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE/) and post a patch there?

thanks
- Robert

Hi,

Thanks for finding and fixing this bug.  However, we don't do pull requests.  Can you file a JIRA against Oozie (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE/) and post a patch there?

thanks
- Robert

Hi,

Thanks for finding and fixing this bug.  However, we don't do pull requests.  Can you post a patch on OOZIE-2571?

thanks
- Robert

Hi,

Thanks for posting this new feature.  However, we don't do pull requests (which is why we haven't noticed this until now when I randomly looked).  Can you file a JIRA against Oozie (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE/) and post a patch there?

thanks
- Robert

Hi,

It should be possible to submit a job to a Hadoop 2.x cluster by putting the RM Address in the `<job-tracker\` field; all of those other addresses you added in the updates schema shouldn't be necessary.  Make sure that you've configured `oozie.service.HadoopAccessorService.hadoop.configurations` (see https://oozie.apache.org/docs/4.2.0/AG_HadoopConfiguration.html).

Also, we don't do pull requests (which is why we haven't noticed this until now when I randomly looked).  In the future, please file a JIRA against Oozie (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE/) and post a patch there.

thanks
- Robert

Submitting a PR automatically adds a link to a patch file (https://patch-diff.githubusercontent.com/raw/apache/oozie/pull/19.patch) on the JIRA. Is that good enough, or do you actually need the patch file added to the JIRA as an attachment?
OK. OOZIE-2589: [https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE-2589](url)

Hi, Robert, did you see my update where I attached a patch file? Thanks.

I'll close this PR since you'll be using the patch file instead.

Oozie does not work with pull request. Please create a Jira for the issue and update the 'git diff' for the review. Link: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE. Thanks.
More information can be found here: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/OOZIE/How+To+Contribute
Pushed to trunk as 2453e6c via JIRA.

Hi, thanks for your interest in contributing to Apache Oozie. We don't do PR for Apache Oozie. You need to create a JIRA https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/VersionBoard.jspa and put up a patch. Have a look at other jiras for oozie such as https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE-2457. Also you can look fo jiras having label "newbie" that would be good point to start contributing. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE-2824?jql=project%20%3D%20oozie%20and%20labels%20%3D%20newbie

Thanks for wanting to contribute!  Docs fixes are definitely welcome.  However, we don't currently use pull requests.  Can you please file a JIRA on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE/ and post a patch?  For doc fixes in particular, we've been gathering them as subtasks under https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE-1881.

See https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/OOZIE/How+To+Contribute for more details.
Thanks, I'll take a look at the wiki on Confluence and file the JIRA issue. Should I close this pull request then?
Please see its corresponding issue: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE-3185
Since PreCommit unit tests are not called, I close this pull request, we can process it using the old style patches. Probably we should test pull requests with a much simpler modification.

Thank you for the suggestion @zuston 

I had added a patch to Jira but it was failing earlier so I created this PR. It seems to be accepted by JIRA now when I re-uploaded it again.

Would you suggest me to close this PR? How will the review process of my patch happen in that case?
You mean to file an issue for this PR or that you require a patch format?
Please open an issue here: https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/OOZIE and attach the fix as a patch file to the new jira.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE-3630

Please do consider making it possible to merge PRs from Github. I'm a  committer for another Apache project (Jena) and we were able to do this with help from INFRA fairly easily. It really makes things easier and lowers the barrier especially for smaller or less expert contributions.
No longer needed due to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE-3599.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.
